Aragonese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin mōnstrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /mosˈtɾa(ɾ)/
  • Syllabification: mos‧trar
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

mostrar

  1. to show

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of mostrar (first conjugation)
infinitive mostrar
gerund mostrando
past participle masculine feminine
singular mostrau, mostrato mostrada, mostrata
plural mostraus, mostratos mostradas, mostratas
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative yo tú él nusatros
nusatras 		vusatros
vusatras 		ellos/els
ellas
present mostro mostras mostra mostramos mostraz mostran
imperfect mostraba, mostrabe mostrabas mostraba mostrabanos mostrabaz mostraban
preterite mostré mostrés mostró mostremos mostrez mostroron, mostrón
future mostraré mostrarás mostrará mostraremos mostrarez mostrarán
conditional mostraría mostrarías mostraría mostraríanos mostraríaz mostrarían
subjunctive yo tú él nusatros
nusatras 		vusatros
vusatras 		ellos/els
ellas
present mostre mostres mostre mostremos mostrez mostren
imperfect mostrase mostrases mostrase mostrasenos mostrasez mostrasen
imperative — tú — — vusatros
vusatras 		—
— mostra — — mostraz —

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Catalan mostrar, from Latin mōnstrāre. First attested in the 12th century.[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [musˈtɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [mosˈtɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [mosˈtɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

mostrar (first-person singular present mostro, first-person singular preterite mostrí, past participle mostrat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /ɔ/

  1. to show, display

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of mostrar (first conjugation)
infinitive mostrar
gerund mostrant
past participle masculine feminine
singular mostrat mostrada
plural mostrats mostrades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present mostro mostres mostra mostrem mostreu mostren
imperfect mostrava mostraves mostrava mostràvem mostràveu mostraven
future mostraré mostraràs mostrarà mostrarem mostrareu mostraran
preterite mostrí mostrares mostrà mostràrem mostràreu mostraren
conditional mostraria mostraries mostraria mostraríem mostraríeu mostrarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present mostri mostris mostri mostrem mostreu mostrin
imperfect mostrés mostressis mostrés mostréssim mostréssiu mostressin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — mostra mostri mostrem mostreu mostrin
negative (no) — no mostris no mostri no mostrem no mostreu no mostrin

Related terms

[edit]
  • demostrar
  • mostra

References

[edit]
  1. ^ “mostrar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025

Further reading

[edit]
  • “mostrar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “mostrar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “mostrar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Galician-Portuguese mostrar, from Latin mōnstrāre.

Verb

[edit]

mostrar (first-person singular present mostro, first-person singular preterite mostrei, past participle mostrado)

  1. (transitive) to show

Occitan

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • muishar (Gascony)

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Occitan mostrar, from Latin mōnstrāre. First attested in the 14th century.[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

mostrar

  1. (Languedoc, transitive) to show

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb needs an inflection-table template.

Related terms

[edit]
  • mòstra

References

[edit]
  1. ^ Diccionari General de la Lenga Occitana‎[1], L’Academia occitana – Consistòri del Gai Saber, 2008-2025, page 394

Old Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin mōnstrāre.

Verb

[edit]

mostrar

  1. (transitive) to show

Related terms

[edit]
  • demostrar

Descendants

[edit]
  • Occitan: mostrar

Portuguese

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • amostrar

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Galician-Portuguese mostrar, from Latin mōnstrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /mosˈtɾa(ʁ)/ [mosˈtɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /mosˈtɾa(ʁ)/ [mosˈtɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /mosˈtɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /moʃˈtɾa(ʁ)/ [moʃˈtɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /mosˈtɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /muʃˈtɾaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /muʃˈtɾaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /muʃˈtɾa.ɾi/

  • Audio (Portugal (Porto)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

mostrar (first-person singular present mostro, first-person singular preterite mostrei, past participle mostrado)

  1. (transitive) to show
    Mostre-o para mim./Mostre-mo ― Show it to me.
    Eu vou-te mostrar. ― I'll show you.
    • 2005, J. K. Rowling, translated by Lia Wyler, Harry Potter e o Enigma do Príncipe [Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince] (Harry Potter; 6), Rio de Janeiro: Rocco, →ISBN, page 143:
      Deixe-me mostrar a você...
      Let me show you...
  2. reflexive of mostrar
  3. to show off (to demonstrate something for the purpose of bragging)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of mostrar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)

Personal mostrar mostrares mostrar mostrarmos mostrardes mostrarem
Gerund
mostrando
Past participle
Masculine mostrado mostrados
Feminine mostrada mostradas
Indicative
Present mostro mostras mostra mostramos mostrais mostram
Imperfect mostrava mostravas mostrava mostrávamos mostráveis mostravam
Preterite mostrei mostraste mostrou mostramos1, mostrámos2 mostrastes mostraram
Pluperfect mostrara mostraras mostrara mostráramos mostráreis mostraram
Future mostrarei mostrarás mostrará mostraremos mostrareis mostrarão
Conditional mostraria mostrarias mostraria mostraríamos mostraríeis mostrariam
Subjunctive
Present mostre mostres mostre mostremos mostreis mostrem
Imperfect mostrasse mostrasses mostrasse mostrássemos mostrásseis mostrassem
Future mostrar mostrares mostrar mostrarmos mostrardes mostrarem
Imperative
Affirmative mostra mostre mostremos mostrai mostrem
Negative (não) não mostres não mostre não mostremos não mostreis não mostrem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin mōnstrāre. Cognate with English muster, Italian mostrare, Occitan muishar and French montrer.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /mosˈtɾaɾ/ [mosˈt̪ɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: mos‧trar

Verb

[edit]

mostrar (first-person singular present muestro, first-person singular preterite mostré, past participle mostrado)

  1. (transitive) to show (have somebody see something)
    Synonyms: enseñar, indicar, señalar
    Quiero mostrarte el jardín
    I want to show you the garden.
    Muéstrame el camino.
    Show me the way.
  2. to demonstrate or display

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of mostrar (o-ue alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive mostrar
gerund mostrando
past participle masculine feminine
singular mostrado mostrada
plural mostrados mostradas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

Swedish

[edit]

Noun

[edit]

mostrar

  1. indefinite plural of moster
